result.execSummary:
The defendant Antonio L Beck was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Drive or Operate Vehicle w/o Consent, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(3).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Huber privileges for work and/or school or vocational training. No electronic monitoring

miscConds.notes: Pay all applicable costs and surcharges, and supervision fees or civil judgment will be entered.

Obtain GED/HSED.
Obtain and maintain employment and/or school and/or vocational training.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.
No contact with the victim, Bruce C. (s) without prior court/agent approval. Any violation may result in additional charges.

Mental Health Evaluation and take all prescribed medications.
Cognitive Intervention programming.
Complete programming at St. Charles.
Complete programming at Pro Trade Developing.
Maintain absolute sobriety. No drugs. No alcohol.
Random urine screens and breathalyzer test.
Provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored. 
Pursuant to 973.015, Court finds the defendant was under the age of 25 at the time of the offense, the charge is a class H or I felony or a misdemeanor, society would not be harmed and the defendant would benefit by expungement. Upon successful completion of the sentence. Court will consider motion for expungement if defendant successfully completes sentence and has not further violations of the law.
Participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Antonio L Beck in court with attorney Alejandro A. Lockwood.  Brad A. Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.

Statements made as to sentencing.
Defendant sentenced to serve 9 MONTHS in the House of Correction with credit for 4 days time served.  Huber privileges for work and/or school or vocational training.  No electronic monitoring.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 2 YEARS.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
* Mental Health Evaluation and take all prescribed medications.
* Cognitive intervention programming.
* Complete programming at St. Charles.
* Complete programming at Pro Trade Developing.
* Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment
   and successfully complete recommended treatment.
* Maintain absolute sobriety.  No drugs.  No alcohol.
* Random urine screens and breathalyzer test.
* No contact with the victim, Bruce C. (s) without prior court/agent approval.  Any violation may result in additional charges.	
* Obtain GED/HSED.
* Obtain and maintain employment and/or school and/or vocational training.
* Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges,
   and supervision fees or CIVIL JUDGMENT will be entered.

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.  Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  

Pursuant to 973.015, Court finds the defendant was under the age of 25 at the time of the offense, the charge is a class H or I felony or a misdemeanor, society would not be harmed and the defendant would benefit by expungement.  Upon successful completion of the sentence.  Court will consider motion for expungement if defendant successfully completes sentence and has no further violations of the law.

  Filed,
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit.

Defendant Antonio L Beck in court with attorney Alejandro A. Lockwood.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.  Defendant has picked up a new charge.  State requesting revocation of the agreement and case be set for sentencing.

The defendant is not in compliance with the terms of the Deferred Prosecution Agreement.  Based upon the defendant's non-compliance and State's motion, the court revoked the Deferred Prosecution Agreement; proceedings reinstated.  Court orders entry of Judgment of Conviction.    Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 6.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 7, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Case should have been on calendar for Branch 06.  File and defendant escorted to Branch 06 by this clerk.

Defendant Antonio L Beck in court with attorney Alejandro A. Lockwood.  Deann L. Heard appeared on behalf of Kimberly D. Schoepp for the State of Wisconsin.  Case was called, then passed, to allow defense counsel to prepare the DPA.

Later same afternoon.  Case recalled.  Same appearances.  The parties have agreed to a deferred prosecution agreement.The defendant was advised of his constitutional rights and maximum penalties, was sworn; defendant waived all rights, entered a plea of GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionaire/Wiaver of Rights and Addendum to Plea Questionaire received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty but WITHHELD entry of Judgement of Conviction.  The Court reviewed conditions with the defendant.  The court approved the Deferred Prosecution Agreement and ordered the proceedings suspended for a period of six months.
Deferred Prosecution Agreement, signed by all parties, and filed.

Defendant Antonio L Beck in court with attorney Alejandro A Lockwood.  Kimberly D Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk    Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 20.  All terms and conditions of bail to remain the same.  Plea hearing scheduled for July 22, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Antonio L Beck in court with attorney Alejandro A Lockwood.  Kimberly D Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Moroney, Branch 20.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 19, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Filed, Justice Point Pretrial Report dated 4/29/14.
css

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION INCLUDING DRUG TESTING AND ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
   Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription AND no drug paraphernalia.
  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Antonio L Beck in court with attorney Alejandro A Lockwood.  Defendant Antonio L Beck in custody.  Carole R Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge MORONEY, Branch 20.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 29, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
